methods.accept:
Accept a batch of rows splayed across per-column chunks of values.

 
 Ownership of data passes to the consumer, which must be sure to
 close each chunk when it's no longer
 needed.

 
 Implementations will generally have a mechanism for determining the expected number and type of input chunks, but
 this is not dictated at the interface level.

:param data: (io.deephaven.engine.v2.sources.chunk.WritableChunk<io.deephaven.engine.v2.sources.chunk.Attributes.Values>...) - Per-column chunks of values. Must all have the same
        size.
methods.acceptFailure:
Report an error while processing the stream.

:param cause: (java.lang.Exception) - the cause of the error
methods.chunkTypeForIndex:
Return the ChunkType for a given column rowSet.

:param idx: (int) - the column rowSet to get the ChunkType for
:return: (io.deephaven.engine.v2.sources.chunk.ChunkType) the ChunkType for the specified column
methods.makeChunksForDefinition:
**Incompatible overloads text - text from the first overload:**

Create an array of chunks suitable for passing to our accept method.

*Overload 1*  
  :param size: (int) - the size of the chunks
  :return: (io.deephaven.engine.v2.sources.chunk.WritableChunk[]) an array of writable chunks
  
*Overload 2*  
  :param definition: (io.deephaven.engine.tables.TableDefinition) - the definition to make chunks for
  :param size: (int) - the size of the returned chunks
  :return: (io.deephaven.engine.v2.sources.chunk.WritableChunk[]) an array of writable chunks
methods.setShutdownCallback:
Set a callback to be invoked when this StreamToTableAdapter will no longer deliver new data to downstream
 consumers.

:param shutdownCallback: (java.lang.Runnable) - The callback
methods.table:
Return the stream table that this adapter is producing.

:return: (io.deephaven.engine.tables.Table) the resultant stream table

text: Adapter for converting streams of data into columnar Deephaven tables.
